steps.title: Show how much you love them with a meaningful quote.
steps.content: Show how much you love them with a meaningful quote. Not sure what to say to the birthday kid or write in their card? No worries! Send them one of these insightful, inspiring, or witty happy birthday quotesâ€”or use them as jumping-off points while you brainstorm your own happy birthday wish: â€œThe older you get, the better you get. Unless youâ€™re a banana.â€ â€“ Betty White â€œGrowing old is mandatory, but growing up is optional.â€ â€“ unknown "Every birthday is a gift. Every day is a gift." â€”Aretha Franklin "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." â€•May Sarton "All your dreams can come true if you have the courage to pursue them." â€”Walt Disney "Birthdays are nature's way of telling us to eat more cake." â€”Edward Morykwas "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, smarter than you think." â€”A.A. Milne "Everything you can imagine is real." â€•Pablo Picasso "Live your life with arms wide open. Today is where your book begins. The rest is still unwritten." â€”Natasha Bedingfield, "Unwrittenâ€ "Being happy never goes out of style." â€”Lily Pulitzer "That's the funny thing about birthdays: they're kind of an annual thing." â€”Rapunzel, Tangled "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." â€”Kurt Vonnegut "Come on Barbie, let's go party." â€” Aqua, "Barbie Girl" "We don't need no guest list. Everybody's invited." â€” Ariana Grande, "Pink Champagne" â€œYou should live every day like it's your birthday." â€”Paris Hilton â€œAge is not important unless youâ€™re a cheese.â€ â€“ Helen Hayes

steps.content: Make the birthday girl or boy laugh with these happy birthday wishes! Laughter is just what every birthday kid needs to make their special day totally perfect! steps.title: Not sure what to get the birthday girl or boy? Try these suggestions!
steps.content: Not sure what to get the birthday girl or boy? Try these suggestions! Youâ€™ve got the perfect birthday wishâ€”now all you need is to find the perfect gift to go along with it! If youâ€™re having trouble coming up with an idea, consider some of these popular gift suggestions for eleven-year-olds: If theyâ€™re into fashion and accessories, get them some fun or chic jewelry, a scarf, or a hatâ€”or take them on a shopping spree to get a new wardrobe! If they love books, get them the next book in their favorite seriesâ€”or pick up your favorite book from when you were their age so they can enjoy it, too! If their favorite books are popular, you can probably find book-related merch, like T-shirts or bookmarks. If theyâ€™re a gamer, consider getting them a giftcard to Steam or Gamestop. Are they into board games? Get them the yearâ€™s coolest new board gameâ€”maybe you can even break it out at their birthday party! Experiential gifts are also great ideas: for example, you could take your 11-year-old loved one to a concert to see their favorite musician, to a sports game to see their favorite team play, to the zoo, or to an amusement park.

steps.title: Plan the party out at least 2 weeks in advance.
steps.content: Plan the party out at least 2 weeks in advance. â€œI would suggest not doing anything last minute,â€ Miller advises. She recommends having all the party-planning details mapped out two weeks in advance â€œto make sure that everything runs completely smoothly.â€ This includes figuring out how many people are coming and what dishes to serve, ordering a cake or finding a cake recipe to make, planning party activities and games, and purchasing decorations .

steps.title: Invite guests 6 weeks before the party.
steps.content: Invite guests 6 weeks before the party. Miller recommends sending out invitations no later than 6 weeks in advance. This will give people plenty of time to figure out their schedules and ensure as many guests can attend as possible. She also advises sending out invites electronically: â€œAlthough I love printed materials, I love letterpress, and I love hand calligraphy; we really try to be mindful of sustainability, and those beautiful pieces are typically just thrown away or recycled.â€

steps.title: Plan kid-friendly and kid-specific activities.
steps.content: Plan kid-friendly and kid-specific activities. For childrenâ€™s parties, â€œit's really smart to bring in entertainment that is specific to the kids,â€ Miller says. This could be specific party games , video games, activities (like swimming or having a water gun fight), or anything you think the birthday kid and their friends would enjoy. If you can, Miller suggests hiring someone or inviting an adult guest who can â€œ[lead] the kids in games, [show] them magic tricksâ€¦and read them exciting stories. And it's just so much fun. It's so exciting for the kidsâ€”also, craft stations.â€

steps.title: Be willing to go with the flow.
steps.content: Be willing to go with the flow. You can plan out all the details perfectly, but, as Miller cautions, â€œinevitably, one thing is going to go wrongâ€¦and usually, it's a pretty big thing, and it's usually out of your control.â€ Her advice? â€œExpect it's going to happen. Be calm about it. If it's not the end of the world, which it typically isnâ€™t, you can find a creative solution if youâ€™re calm and relaxed.â€ â€œIf you're uptight and screaming and freaking out,â€ she says, â€œthen that doesn't give your mind the ability to open up and expand and figure out problem-solving.â€
